title: Newbie needs HELP identifying a font!
content:
I am trying to emulate the “look” of Natural American Spirit cigarettes.

Anyone know what font that is?

I’m guessing it’s an Outline font, but it is actually more of a thick font with an inline stroke.

I would appreciate any info. Thnx.

 [‹ (x) Kongekabale compressed sans on DVD cover - Univers UltCond {Richard Hards}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080924105952/http:/typophile.com/node/36547 "Go to previous forum topic") [Hard Drive Died... Lost Font for my Business Card ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080924105952/http:/typophile.com/node/41350 "Go to next forum topic")
author: knockout

comments.content: You might find something helpful in Typographica’s entry [Font Spotting the _Thank You for Smoking_ Titles](http://web.archive.org/web/20080924105952/http:/typographica.org/001054.php).

OMG!!! You ROCK! I think this may be close enough for me to do what I want... I can tweek it in Illustrator.

Right on!

thnx bro!

thanks buddy. you still rock, too!

appreciate the help.

this is a fun forum. usually I am the one identifying but needed a little help with this one.

thnx bro.
It looks like Helvetica Invisible from here.
